definitions.definition: ( intransitive , textiles ) Of a woven fabric surface, to form small matted balls of fiber.
To form into the shape of a pill.
examples: Pilling is a skill rarely used by modern pharmacists.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To medicate with pills; to administer pills to.
examples: She pills herself with all sorts of herbal medicines.
Pilling the cat is such a nightmare.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , Internet slang ) To persuade or convince someone of something.
( transitive , UK , slang , dated ) To blackball (a potential club member).

main_definition: ( intransitive , textiles ) Of a woven fabric surface, to form small matted balls of fiber.
secondary_definitions: To form into the shape of a pill.
( transitive ) To medicate with pills; to administer pills to.
( transitive , Internet slang ) To persuade or convince someone of something.
( transitive , UK , slang , dated ) To blackball (a potential club member).

definitions.definition: To peel ; to remove the outer layer of hair , skin , or bark .
To peel; to make by removing the skin.
To be peeled ; to peel off in flakes.
To pillage ; to despoil or impoverish .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To peel ; to remove the outer layer of hair , skin , or bark .
secondary_definitions: To peel; to make by removing the skin.
To be peeled ; to peel off in flakes.
( obsolete ) To pillage ; to despoil or impoverish .
